CA_CE_CONCESSIONAIRE_PROFILE.ADDRESS: Northumbrian Water Limited, Boldon House, Wheatlands Way, Pity Me, Durham DH1 5FA

TITLE_CONTRACT.P: Hanningfield Washwater Tanks Extension — Main Construction Works

LOCATION.P: Hanningfield Water Treatment Works which is located within Essex and Suffolk Water's Operating Region. The address of the works is:
Hanningfield Water Treatment Works, Middlemead, South Hanningfield Chelmsford, Essex, CM3 8HS.

SHORT_CONTRACT_DESCRIPTION.P: Northumbrian Water Limited intend to appoint a contractor to carry out the construction of 2 nº wash water tank and pumping station. It should be noted that while detailed design is not part of the scope of this appointment there may be a residual amount of design work to do under the main construction works contract.
The project objective is to build 2 nº new wash water tanks and a pumping station alongside the existing wash water tanks and pumping station.
Construction is scheduled to start in 7.2018, Asset/Works in use shall be before 1.2020 as this is a date agreed with the Environment Agency.
NWL expects a partner contractor to work collaboratively to deliver a solution meeting our business outcomes aligned to our vision, values and behaviours.

The existing tanks will remain in service and be incorporated in to the new works, the existing pumping station and tanks will be refurbished only once the new works is fully commissioned and in service.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: The scope of works will include:
1. Reduced level excavation for the wash water tanks and pumping station basement including the installation and removal of temporary works.
2. Construction of two new concrete wash water tanks.
3. Construction of new pumping station comprising of pump basement, interconnecting pipe work to the tanks and an above ground building to house the new MCC and beam crane.
5. Construction of hard standings and access roads.
7. Supply, installation and commissioning of all M&E equipment e.g. pumps, pipework, valves, control systems, MCC, sub-station and new HV electricity supply.
8. Diversion of existing pipes and cables.
10. Construction of a new overflow structure at the emergency lagoon.
11. Provision of signage, safety barriers, metalwork and safety notices.
12. Any residual design not completed during the detailed design e.g. design of MCCs.
13. Refurbishment of old wash water tanks (2 of).
14. Removal of old wash water pumps from the existing pumping station, installation of new sludge pumps.
15. The need to keep the current system running during the construction of the new works.
16. Supply and installation of a new HV electrical supply and transformer 11 kv to 400 v.
17. ICA control — A fully automated PLC controlled process, with HMIs communicating back to the Central SCADA network.
